source.g: Click a solution component to find out more.$$_null$$
Communications Cloud Solutions Map$$_null$$
Digital Channels$$_null$$

Communications Cloud is omnichannel, which means it works with many channels, including web shops, apps, and agent consoles. Information entered by users in one channel is available to them in other channels, depending on their role and access requirements.
Communications Cloud also integrates with external applications, such as billing platforms and network inventory systems to share data.
Enterprise Sales Management and Mobile Subscription Management
$$_null$$
Two applications extend the functionality provided by Communications Cloud to suit the products and processes of their target users.
Enterprise Sales Management (ESM) supports sales people in CSPs who sell to large, multisite customers.
Mobile Subscription Management (MSM) supports consumer mobile service providers.
Communications Industry Data Model$$_null$$

Communications Cloud gives you a TM Forum SID-compliant structure to support the development of your data model and accompanying processes. This includes structures for offer specifications, bundles, promotions, products, services, resources, rules, pricing, and decomposition maps.
Enterprise Product Catalog (EPC)$$_null$$
Extend the shared catalog with the Enterprise Product Catalog (EPC). EPC adds product-lifecycle-management support to the shared catalog, including product versioning.
Industries Configure-Price-Quote (CPQ)$$_null$$

Industries Configure-Price-Quote (CPQ) is the powerhouse of the quote-and-order-creation process in Communications Cloud. Driven by underlying shared catalog data, Industries CPQ gives sales teams advanced order-capture and guided-selling capabilities so they can offer best-fit products and services to customers across different channels.
Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM)$$_null$$

CLM supports the documentation requirements of the sales cycle, such as proposal and contract approval. CLM administrators author and assemble contract clauses and templates into dynamically generated documents to meet the needs of sales users. This reduces review and approval cycles, enabling teams to negotiate and close deals faster.
Industries Digital Commerce$$_null$$

Digital Commerce enables high-volume browsing and configuration of product offers on self-service channels, advanced order-capture, guided selling, and management of peak traffic. For example, use Industries Digital Commerce to integrate Communications Cloud with your existing web store.
Industries Order Management (OM)$$_null$$

Industries OM fulfills submitted orders by breaking them down into their component parts, which is called decomposition. Then it orchestrates the components across relevant systems and parties to fulfill the order.
Shared Catalog$$_null$$

The shared catalog underpins the catalog-driven solution and provides a single point of truth for commercial product and service information. Use the shared catalog to quickly create, test, launch, and update new product and service offerings from reusable product, service, and asset components.
OmniStudio$$_null$$
OmniStudio is part of the Salesforce Digital Process Automation suite of tools, which supports integration and automation across your Salesforce Cloud.
TBD$$_null$$
TBD
Success$$_null$$
Share resources and guidance customers need to achieve long-term success with Salesforce through always-on solutions like adoption and professional services.
Slack$$_null$$
Slack

connects your teams, tools, customers, and partners in a digital place thatâ€™s fast, flexible, and inclusive in a work-from-anywhere world. It helps customers break down communication and collaboration silos, embrace flexibility so employees can do their best work, and bring the power of automation to everyone.
